cards.question: What is photosynthesis?
cards.answer: The process by which green plants convert sunlight into chemical energy.

cards.question: What molecule carries genetic information?
cards.answer: DNA (Deoxyribonucleic acid).

cards.question: What is an atom?
cards.answer: The smallest unit of a chemical element.

cards.question: Define pH.
cards.answer: A measure of acidity or alkalinity of a solution.

cards.question: Where is the Amazon River?
cards.answer: South America.

cards.question: What is the capital of France?
cards.answer: Paris.

cards.question: Which desert is the largest in the world?
cards.answer: The Sahara Desert.

cards.question: What is the longest mountain range?
cards.answer: The Andes.

cards.question: แบบแสดงความจ านงของนักเรียนโครงการ 2B – KMUTT ใช้เพื่ออะไร?
cards.answer: เพื่อเข้าศึกษาต่อระดับปริญญาตรี มหาวิทยาลัยเทคโนโลยีพระจอมเกล้าธนบุรี

cards.question: ส่วนที่ 1 ของแบบแสดงความจ านงเกี่ยวข้องกับข้อมูลใด?
cards.answer: ข้อมูลกรอกโดยนักเรียน

cards.question: นักเรียนต้องระบุชื่อภาควิชาที่มีความต้องการเข้าศึกษามากที่สุดกี่อันดับ?
cards.answer: 2 อันดับ

cards.question: ส่วนที่ 2 ของแบบแสดงความจ านงเกี่ยวข้องกับข้อมูลใด?
cards.answer: ความเห็นอาจารย์ / นักวิจัยพี่เลี้ยง

cards.question: อาจารย์ / นักวิจัยพี่เลี้ยงต้องประเมินคุณลักษณะด้านใดของนักเรียน?
cards.answer: คุณลักษณะด้านต่างๆ เช่น ความคิดริเริ่มสร้างสรรค์, ปฏิภาณไหวพริบ, ความมุ่งมั่น, ความเอาใจใส่, ความซื่อสัตย์, ความรับผิดชอบ, ความตรงต่อเวลา, มนุษยสัมพันธ์

cards.question: แบบแสดงความจ านงต้องส่งภายในวันใด?
cards.answer: วันศุกร์ที่ 11 เมษายน 2568

cards.question: การส่งแบบแสดงความจ านงสามารถทำได้ทางใด?
cards.answer: ส่งมาที่สำนักงานคัดเลือกและสรรหานักศึกษา อาคาร Discovery Center of KMUTT (S1) หรืออีเมล admission@kmutt.ac.th

cards.question: การประเมินนี้มีผลต่อการพิจารณาคัดเลือกนักเรียนอย่างไร?
cards.answer: มีผลต่อการพิจารณาคัดเลือกนักเรียนที่มีความสามารถเพื่อเข้าศึกษาต่อเป็นอย่างมาก

cards.question: What does the National Curriculum Framework (NCF) 2005 recommend for children's life at school?
cards.answer: The National Curriculum Framework (NCF) 2005 recommends that children’s life at school must be linked to their life outside the school.

cards.question: What is the principle that marks a departure from the legacy of bookish learning?
cards.answer: The principle that marks a departure from the legacy of bookish learning is linking children's life at school to their life outside the school.

cards.question: What is the aim of the syllabi and textbooks developed on the basis of NCF?
cards.answer: The aim of the syllabi and textbooks developed on the basis of NCF is to implement the basic idea of linking children's life at school to their life outside the school, discourage rote learning, and maintain sharp boundaries between different subject areas.

cards.question: What is the National Policy on Education (1986) that outlines a child-centred system of education?
cards.answer: The National Policy on Education (1986) outlines a child-centred system of education.

cards.question: What is the success of the effort to implement the NCF 2005 recommendations dependent on?
cards.answer: The success of the effort to implement the NCF 2005 recommendations depends on the steps that school principals and teachers will take to encourage children to reflect on their own learning and to pursue imaginative activities and questions.

cards.question: What is the role of children in generating new knowledge?
cards.answer: Children generate new knowledge by engaging with the information passed on to them by adults, given space, time and freedom.

cards.question: What is the key reason why other resources and sites of learning are ignored?
cards.answer: Treating the prescribed textbook as the sole basis of examination is one of the key reasons why other resources and sites of learning are ignored.

cards.question: How can creativity and initiative be inculcated in children?
cards.answer: Creativity and initiative can be inculcated if we perceive and treat children as participants in learning, not as receivers of a fixed body of knowledge.

cards.question: What changes are implied in school routines and mode of functioning?
cards.answer: The aims imply considerable change in school routines and mode of functioning, including flexibility in the daily time-table and rigour in implementing the annual calendar.

cards.question: What is the role of the methods used for teaching and evaluation in making the textbook effective?
cards.answer: The methods used for teaching and evaluation will also determine how effective this textbook proves for making children’s life at school a happy experience, rather than a source of stress or boredom.

cards.question: What have syllabus designers tried to address?
cards.answer: Syllabus designers have tried to address the problem of curricular burden by restructuring and reorienting knowledge at different stages with greater consideration for child psychology and the time available for teaching.

cards.question: What does the textbook attempt to enhance?
cards.answer: The textbook attempts to enhance this endeavour by giving higher priority and space to opportunities for contemplation and wondering, discussion in small groups, and activities requiring hands-on experience.

cards.question: Who does the National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT) appreciate for their hard work?
cards.answer: The National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT) appreciates the hard work done by the textbook development committee responsible for this book.

cards.question: Who is the Chairperson of the advisory group in science and mathematics?
cards.answer: Professor J.V. Narlikar is the Chairperson of the advisory group in science and mathematics.

cards.question: Who is the Chief Advisor for this book?
cards.answer: Professor K. Muralidhar, Department of Zoology, University of Delhi, Delhi is the Chief Advisor for this book.

cards.question: Who contributed to the development of this textbook?
cards.answer: Several teachers contributed to the development of this textbook.

cards.question: Who is NCERT grateful to for making the development of this textbook possible?
cards.answer: NCERT is grateful to the principals of the teachers who contributed to the development of this textbook for making this possible.

cards.question: What does NCERT welcome for further revision and refinement?
cards.answer: NCERT welcomes comments and suggestions which will enable us to undertake further revision and refinement.

cards.question: Who is the Director of the National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT)?
cards.answer: The Director of the National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT) is not specified in the text.

cards.question: When was the foreword written?
cards.answer: The foreword was written on 20 November 2006.

cards.question: What is the reprint year of the textbook?
cards.answer: The reprint year of the textbook is 2025-26.

cards.answer: The National Curriculum Framework (NCF) 2005 recommends that children’s life at school must be linked to their life outside the school.

cards.answer: The National Policy on Education (1986) outlines a child-centred system of education.

cards.answer: The success of the NCF 2005 depends on the steps that school principals and teachers will take to encourage children to reflect on their own learning and to pursue imaginative activities and questions.

cards.answer: The National Monitoring Committee is under the Chairmanship of Professor Mrinal Miri and Professor G.P. Deshpande.

cards.question: What does NCERT welcome for further revision and refinement?
cards.answer: NCERT welcomes comments and suggestions which will enable us to undertake further revision and refinement.

cards.question: Who is the Director of the National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT)?
cards.answer: The Director of the National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT) is not specified in the text.

cards.question: When was the foreword written?
cards.answer: The foreword was written on 20 November 2006.

cards.question: What is the reprint year of the textbook?
cards.answer: The reprint year of the textbook is 2025-26.

cards.question: What does the National Curriculum Framework (NCF) 2005 recommend for children's life at school?
cards.answer: The National Curriculum Framework (NCF) 2005 recommends that children’s life at school must be linked to their life outside the school.

cards.question: What is the legacy of bookish learning?
cards.answer: The legacy of bookish learning continues to shape our system and causes a gap between the school, home and community.

cards.question: What do the syllabi and textbooks developed on the basis of NCF signify?
cards.answer: The syllabi and textbooks developed on the basis of NCF signify an attempt to implement the basic idea of linking children's life at school to their life outside the school.

cards.question: What do the syllabi and textbooks attempt to discourage?
cards.answer: The syllabi and textbooks attempt to discourage rote learning and the maintenance of sharp boundaries between different subject areas.

cards.question: What is the National Policy on Education (1986) about?
cards.answer: The National Policy on Education (1986) outlines a child-centred system of education.

cards.question: What is necessary for the success of the effort to implement the NCF?
cards.answer: The success of this effort depends on the steps that school principals and teachers will take to encourage children to reflect on their own learning and to pursue imaginative activities and questions.

cards.question: How do children generate new knowledge?
cards.answer: Children generate new knowledge by engaging with the information passed on to them by adults, given space, time and freedom.

cards.question: What is one of the key reasons why other resources and sites of learning are ignored?
cards.answer: Treating the prescribed textbook as the sole basis of examination is one of the key reasons why other resources and sites of learning are ignored.

cards.question: How can creativity and initiative be inculcated in children?
cards.answer: Inculcating creativity and initiative is possible if we perceive and treat children as participants in learning, not as receivers of a fixed body of knowledge.

cards.question: What changes are implied in school routines and mode of functioning?
cards.answer: These aims imply considerable change in school routines and mode of functioning.

cards.question: What is necessary in the daily time-table?
cards.answer: Flexibility in the daily time-table is as necessary as rigour in implementing the annual calendar so that the required number of teaching days are actually devoted to teaching.

cards.question: What will determine how effective the textbook proves for making children’s life at school a happy experience?
cards.answer: The methods used for teaching and evaluation will also determine how effective this textbook proves for making children’s life at school a happy experience, rather than a source of stress or boredom.

cards.question: What have syllabus designers tried to address?
cards.answer: Syllabus designers have tried to address the problem of curricular burden by restructuring and reorienting knowledge at different stages with greater consideration for child psychology and the time available for teaching.

cards.answer: The textbook attempts to enhance this endeavour by giving higher priority and space to opportunities for contemplation and wondering, discussion in small groups, and activities requiring hands-on experience.

cards.question: ส่วนที่ 1 ของแบบแสดงความจ านงเกี่ยวข้องกับข้อมูลอะไร?
cards.answer: ข้อมูลกรอกโดยนักเรียน

cards.question: นักเรียนต้องระบุชื่อภาควิชาที่มีความต้องการเข้าศึกษามากที่สุดกี่อันดับ?
cards.answer: 2 อันดับ

cards.question: ส่วนที่ 2 ของแบบแสดงความจ านงเกี่ยวข้องกับข้อมูลอะไร?
cards.answer: ความเห็นอาจารย์ / นักวิจัยพี่เลี้ยง

cards.question: อาจารย์ / นักวิจัยพี่เลี้ยงต้องประเมินคุณลักษณะด้านใดของนักเรียน?
cards.answer: คุณลักษณะด้านต่างๆ เช่น ความคิดริเริ่มสร้างสรรค์, ปฏิภาณไหวพริบ, ความมุ่งมั่น, ความเอาใจใส่, ความซื่อสัตย์, ความรับผิดชอบ, ความตรงต่อเวลา, มนุษยสัมพันธ์

cards.question: แบบแสดงความจ านงต้องส่งภายในวันไหน?
cards.answer: วันศุกร์ที่ 11 เมษายน 2568

cards.question: แบบแสดงความจ านงต้องส่งไปที่ไหน?
cards.answer: ส านักงานคัดเลือกและสรรหานักศึกษา อาคาร Discovery Center of KMUTT (S1) หรืออีเมล admission@kmutt.ac.th

cards.question: การประเมินนี้มีผลต่อการพิจารณาคัดเลือกนักเรียนอย่างไร?
cards.answer: มีผลต่อการพิจารณาคัดเลือกนักเรียนที่มีความสามารถเพื่อเข้าศึกษาต่อเป็นอย่างมาก

cards.question: What does the National Curriculum Framework (NCF) 2005 recommend for children's life at school?
cards.answer: The National Curriculum Framework (NCF) 2005 recommends that children’s life at school must be linked to their life outside the school.

cards.question: What is the principle that marks a departure from the legacy of bookish learning?
cards.answer: The principle that marks a departure from the legacy of bookish learning is linking children's life at school to their life outside the school.

cards.question: What is the aim of the syllabi and textbooks developed on the basis of NCF?
cards.answer: The aim of the syllabi and textbooks developed on the basis of NCF is to implement the basic idea of linking children's life at school to their life outside the school, discourage rote learning, and maintain sharp boundaries between different subject areas.

cards.question: What is the National Policy on Education (1986) that outlines a child-centred system of education?
cards.answer: The National Policy on Education (1986) outlines a child-centred system of education.

cards.question: What is the success of the effort to implement the NCF 2005 recommendations dependent on?
cards.answer: The success of the effort to implement the NCF 2005 recommendations depends on the steps that school principals and teachers will take to encourage children to reflect on their own learning and to pursue imaginative activities and questions.

cards.question: What is the role of children in generating new knowledge?
cards.answer: Children generate new knowledge by engaging with the information passed on to them by adults, given space, time and freedom.

cards.question: What is one of the key reasons why other resources and sites of learning are ignored?
cards.answer: Treating the prescribed textbook as the sole basis of examination is one of the key reasons why other resources and sites of learning are ignored.

cards.question: How can inculcating creativity and initiative be possible?
cards.answer: Inculcating creativity and initiative is possible if we perceive and treat children as participants in learning, not as receivers of a fixed body of knowledge.

cards.question: What changes are implied in school routines and mode of functioning?
cards.answer: The aims imply considerable change in school routines and mode of functioning, including flexibility in the daily time-table and rigour in implementing the annual calendar.

cards.question: What will determine how effective the textbook proves for making children’s life at school a happy experience?
cards.answer: The methods used for teaching and evaluation will determine how effective the textbook proves for making children’s life at school a happy experience.

cards.question: What have syllabus designers tried to address?
cards.answer: Syllabus designers have tried to address the problem of curricular burden by restructuring and reorienting knowledge at different stages with greater consideration for child psychology and the time available for teaching.

cards.question: What does the textbook attempt to enhance?
cards.answer: The textbook attempts to enhance the endeavour by giving higher priority and space to opportunities for contemplation and wondering, discussion in small groups, and activities requiring hands-on experience.

cards.question: Who does the National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT) appreciate for the hard work done on the textbook?
cards.answer: The National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT) appreciates the hard work done by the textbook development committee responsible for this book.

cards.question: Who is the Chairperson of the advisory group in science and mathematics?
cards.answer: Professor J.V. Narlikar is the Chairperson of the advisory group in science and mathematics.

cards.question: Who is the Chief Advisor for the book?
cards.answer: Professor K. Muralidhar, Department of Zoology, University of Delhi, Delhi is the Chief Advisor for the book.

cards.question: Who contributed to the development of the textbook?
cards.answer: Several teachers contributed to the development of the textbook.

cards.question: Who is NCERT grateful to for making the development of the textbook possible?
cards.answer: NCERT is grateful to the principals of the teachers who contributed to the development of the textbook for making this possible.

cards.question: What does NCERT welcome for further revision and refinement?
cards.answer: NCERT welcomes comments and suggestions which will enable us to undertake further revision and refinement.

cards.question: Who is the Director of the National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT)?
cards.answer: The Director of the National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT) is not specified in the text.

cards.question: When was the foreword written?
cards.answer: The foreword was written on 20 November 2006.

cards.question: What is the reprint year of the textbook?
cards.answer: The reprint year of the textbook is 2025-26.

cards.question: What does the National Curriculum Framework (NCF) 2005 recommend for children's life at school?
cards.answer: The National Curriculum Framework (NCF) 2005 recommends that children’s life at school must be linked to their life outside the school.

cards.question: What is the principle that marks a departure from the legacy of bookish learning?
cards.answer: The principle that marks a departure from the legacy of bookish learning is linking children's life at school to their life outside the school.

cards.question: What is the aim of the syllabi and textbooks developed on the basis of NCF?
cards.answer: The aim of the syllabi and textbooks developed on the basis of NCF is to implement the basic idea of linking children's life at school to their life outside the school, discourage rote learning, and maintain sharp boundaries between different subject areas.

cards.question: What is the National Policy on Education (1986) that the NCF 2005 aims to implement?
cards.answer: The National Policy on Education (1986) outlines a child-centred system of education.

cards.question: What is the role of school principals and teachers in the success of the NCF 2005?
cards.answer: The success of the NCF 2005 depends on the steps that school principals and teachers will take to encourage children to reflect on their own learning and to pursue imaginative activities and questions.

cards.question: What is the key reason why other resources and sites of learning are ignored?
cards.answer: Treating the prescribed textbook as the sole basis of examination is one of the key reasons why other resources and sites of learning are ignored.

cards.question: How can inculcating creativity and initiative be possible?
cards.answer: Inculcating creativity and initiative is possible if we perceive and treat children as participants in learning, not as receivers of a fixed body of knowledge.

cards.question: What changes are implied in school routines and mode of functioning?
cards.answer: The aims imply considerable change in school routines and mode of functioning, including flexibility in the daily time-table and rigour in implementing the annual calendar.

cards.question: What is the role of the methods used for teaching and evaluation in the effectiveness of the textbook?
cards.answer: The methods used for teaching and evaluation will also determine how effective this textbook proves for making children’s life at school a happy experience, rather than a source of stress or boredom.

cards.question: What have syllabus designers tried to address?
cards.answer: Syllabus designers have tried to address the problem of curricular burden by restructuring and reorienting knowledge at different stages with greater consideration for child psychology and the time available for teaching.

cards.question: What does the textbook attempt to enhance?
cards.answer: The textbook attempts to enhance this endeavour by giving higher priority and space to opportunities for contemplation and wondering, discussion in small groups, and activities requiring hands-on experience.

cards.question: Who does the National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT) appreciate for their hard work?
cards.answer: The National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT) appreciates the hard work done by the textbook development committee responsible for this book.

cards.question: Who are the Chairperson of the advisory group in science and mathematics and the Chief Advisor for this book?
cards.answer: The Chairperson of the advisory group in science and mathematics is Professor J.V. Narlikar and the Chief Advisor for this book is Professor K. Muralidhar, Department of Zoology, University of Delhi, Delhi.

cards.question: Who contributed to the development of this textbook?
cards.answer: Several teachers contributed to the development of this textbook.

cards.question: Who are the members of the National Monitoring Committee?
cards.answer: The members of the National Monitoring Committee are appointed by the Department of Secondary and Higher Education, Ministry of Human Resource Development under the Chairmanship of Professor Mrinal Miri and Professor G.P. Deshpande.

cards.question: What does NCERT welcome for further revision and refinement?
cards.answer: NCERT welcomes comments and suggestions which will enable us to undertake further revision and refinement.

cards.question: Who is the Director of the National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT)?
cards.answer: The Director of the National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT) is not specified in the text.

cards.question: When was the foreword written?
cards.answer: The foreword was written on 20 November 2006.

cards.question: What is the reprint year of the textbook?
cards.answer: The reprint year of the textbook is 2025-26.
